Description: Harvest was conducted in a 31-year-old Chamaecyparis obtusa forest in August 1983 (Karizumi and Terada 1984). Sample trees were selected to represent each diameter class. Roots were excavated, separated into soil depth and into very large (diameter >= 5 cm), large (2-5 cm), medium (0.5-2 cm), small (0.2-0.5 cm), fine (< 0.2 cm) roots, and weighted. Fine and small roots were estimated by soil block sampling method.
